subject: Re: [junit] Testing inner classes with junitx
msgSnippet: ... Is the inner class static? If so, use Outer.Pair instead of just Pair as the class name. If not, then I recommend making it static, because non-static
messageBody:
Leila wrote:

> I have no idea where to start. Since the following
> code would not compile:
> Pair p = (Pair) invoke(d, "mostFlexible", new Object[]
> { mcss });
> Pair (the inner class) is not recognized in junitx
> test.

Is the inner class static? If so, use "Outer.Pair" instead of just
"Pair" as the class name.

If not, then I recommend making it static, because non-static inner
classes are almost always needless complexity.

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
